instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green Light, fan Spins, Half Chime, then turn off.
threads.message:
Hello my dear friend of the repair world. I have a highly sodomised motherboard. An <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B. I don't know what happend to it. It came in a bag by mail. And worst of all others repair shop "see it" before me.
The problem strong green light in original, not orange when battery conected. Turn on chime or half chime and them shuts down. Fan spins.

First i ultrasonic clean it. I make a few messurements with an oscilloscope and i can see a very tiny ripple. Al messurementes are in range. [TABLE="border: 0, cellspacing: 0"]
 	 		[TR]
 			[TD="align: left"]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/TD]
 			[TD="align: left"]Valor[/TD]
 			[TD="align: left"]Valor medido[/TD]
 		[/TR]
 		[TR]
 			[TD="align: left"]<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 			[TD="align: right"]1,25[/TD]
 			[TD="align: right"]1,25[/TD]
 		[/TR]
 		[TR]
 			[TD="align: left"]<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 			[TD="align: right"]1,05[/TD]
 			[TD="align: right"]1,05[/TD]
 		[/TR]
 		[TR]
 			[TD="align: left"]<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_MCP</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 			[TD="align: right"]1,05[/TD]
 			[TD="align: right"]1,05[/TD]
 		[/TR]
 		[TR]
 			[TD="align: left"]<SIGNAL>PPDDRVTT_S0</SIGNAL>[/TD]
 			[TD="align: right"]0,75[/TD]
 			[TD="align: right"]0,75[/TD]
 		[/TR]
 		[TR]

 Amd a footnote rossman speak's like Jerry Seinfeld =).
I hope i can get some help if it cannot be fix there's no problem i have many mone in this bag.
=)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green Light, fan Spins, Half Chime, then turn off.
threads.message: Check LVDS connector, after chime do you see something on the screen????

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green Light, fan Spins, Half Chime, then turn off.
threads.message: Half chime is many times a short on the LCD connector/backlight. Disconnect LCD and see if it still shuts down. Check backlight fuse if it is bridged.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green Light, fan Spins, Half Chime, then turn off.
threads.message: Nop. No luck. I been checking arround proccesor and I just found a bit of corrosion in <TRANSISTOR>Q7620</TRANSISTOR> and it's a very critical component. =(.
